0.Pros: Good first job experience, shows who is willing to work and who won't make it.
0.Cons: Long hours with managers who complain about doing all the work but actually just sit on their butts. Even me being pregnant right now I still do more work than them.

1.Pros: I LOVE that McDonald's is willing to work with my schedule while I am still in school, there are not many companies that want to be bothered by all the scheduling inconveniences and extra work that comes with building a schedule with many students. I am able to work when I can and also pick up any hours I need on the side. The managers are always willing to help me get what I need in order to devote most of my time to my studies.
1.Cons: People are always getting hired and then just quitting through no call no shows. We work extremely hard day to day and it never seems to be appreciated in the least bit. There is always only criticism and a list of things that we need to work on. We only get thirty minute meal breaks which fly by when you're working a nine sometimes ten hour shift and can't make it to the restroom as you would like to. We are human too and have to be subjected to some extremely harsh circumstances all while expected to smile, be warm and have everything perfect. All to get paid bi-weekly and barely make it to the next pay period. I don't know anyone at my job that can honestly say that they are surviving off of the money they make at McDonald's which is why we have to break our backs just to pay the bills. I have worked at McDonald's for 3 years and my heart breaks for my co-workers and myself, we deserve better.

4.Summary: "Annoying at times, though constantly eye-opening and enlightening."
4.Pros: The best thing about working at McDonald's is the people. You meet all different kinds of people here. I'm lucky because all of my coworkers and almost all of my managers are nice and easygoing. When people ask me about customers, I always tell them that for every mean customer, there's 100 nice customers, and a few extraordinary ones. I've had a customer give me an intricate drawing on a napkin, one gave me book of poems he had written on looseleaf paper and stapled (they were beautiful) and a few have done impressions over the speaker when I take orders, I especially loved the impression of Shaggy from Scooby Doo I got once. There are many lovely people who I meet each shift I work; they are blessings in my work day.
4.Cons: The managers are occasionally over-expectant, sometimes you do not receive enough guidance. Some customers give you an attitude, some treat you like dirt, some treat you like you aren't a person. With each person I meet like this, I just learn more about humanity.
